title: The cDc Compilation - Volume One
authors: cDc - Cult of the Dead Cow
historical_context: This article is part of the early hacking culture, showcasing the work of the Cult of the Dead Cow, a prominent hacker group known for their contributions to the hacker community and their advocacy for digital rights.
target_audience: Hackers, digital rights activists, and those interested in the history of hacker culture.
short_summary: This compilation features a collection of files from the Cult of the Dead Cow, showcasing their early work and contributions to the hacker community. It serves as a historical artifact of hacker culture in the late 1980s.
summary: The cDc Compilation - Volume One is a significant release from the Cult of the Dead Cow, a group that played a pivotal role in the hacker scene of the late 1980s. This double-sided disk includes files #1-15 from the cDc, along with other notable contributions from various authors. The compilation not only highlights the creativity and technical prowess of its contributors but also serves as a testament to the collaborative spirit of the hacker community during that era. The cDc's work is characterized by its blend of technical insight and a rebellious attitude towards authority, making it a cornerstone of hacker literature.
additional_notes: The compilation is a precursor to future volumes that would encompass a broader range of cDc releases, indicating the group's commitment to preserving and sharing their work. The acknowledgment of other hacker groups and individuals in the introduction reflects the interconnected nature of the hacking community, emphasizing the importance of collaboration and support among peers.
